title.title: MS. Georg. d. 2
Typicon of the Georgian monastery of the Holy Cross near Jerusalem
ტიპიკონი ჯვრის მონასტრისა
tipikoni jvris monastrisa

respStmt.resp: transcribed from original MS and converted to XML format

msDesc.head: Typicon of the Georgian monastery of the Holy Cross near Jerusalem

msContents.summary: Typicon of the Georgian monastery of the Holy Cross near Jerusalem was written in 14th century. The Typikon is a book of directives and rubrics that establishes in the Christian Church the order of divine services for each day of the year and it assumes the existence of special liturgical books that contain the fixed parts of these activities. This Manuscript consists of five parts with a lot of additions indicating the numbers of psalms in the book of Psalms. The text is written in Nuskhuri script with additions in Mkhedruli, while Asomtavruli script is used for titles, the first letters of paragraphs and sometimes for decoration.

supportDesc.support: The Manuscript is written on paper. The first and the last pages are missing.

foliation.p: There is not any kind of original pagination.
Pencil pagination is added probably by the library.

supportDesc.collation: The written leaves are preceded by title page.
supportDesc.condition: Several leaves of manuscript are damaged with small holes and dark stains.

handDesc.handNote: Hand I writes on 2v, 27v, 95(1)v, 121r, 121v, 221r in Mkhedruli script.
Hand II writes the whole text in Asomtavruli and Nuskhuri. Probably, the second hand is older than ohters and the text itself is written by the second one.
Hand III writes on the first folio in Mkherduli script of Georgian and Greek.
Hand IV writes additions on the 39v, 40v, 41v, 104r, 118v, 119v, 121v, 121r, 127r folios in Nuskhuri script, probably similar to the Hand II.
Hand V writes additions on 39r, 59r folios in Nuskhuri script.
Hand VI writes additions on 42r, 54r, 57r, 112r, 146r, 160r, 168r, 172r, 173v, 174r folios in Nuskhuri script.

decoDesc.decoNote: The Manuscript has not decorations, but sometimes a letter "Ⴇ" (t) written in Asomtavruli script is used to decorate margins.

binding.p:
The panel is covered with brown leather over wooden board. Leather is scraped and covered with a small fragment of paper with the following text: ტიპიკონი
ჯვარის არის
იცოდეთ
ჩ ყ ვ
ლავრენ
ტის
შ῀ე ⴕⴄ
Sewing is visible.
binding.decoNote: The cover has three border frames. From time to time a letter "Ⴇ" (t) written in Asomtavruli script is used to decorate margins

history.provenance: Bought from the Church Missionary Society by the Wardrop Fund on 25 November 1911
history.acquisition: Donated to the Bodleian Libraries by Wardrop Fund.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted (2019) from the following sources:
David Barret's Catalogue of the Wardrop Collection and of other Georgian Books and Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Published by the Marjory Wardrop Fund by Oxford University Press 1973 216536082

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions). Contact specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript
